basics.name: Philippe CARLE
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary:
Hi! I'm a Web Developer. I've been working for almost a decade as a Lead Developer on advanced Web Apps and APIs in PHP, mainly using the Symfony Framework. In order to maintain a high level of quality and maintenability, I have been collaborating regularly wih senior consultants and developers from SensioLabs (the creators of Symfony) and with some of their close business partners. I have been working as a freelance, as well as in a successful startup and now in an international industrial group.

I always advocate in my teams for best practices compliance as well as I keep in mind business' needs and features-delivery expectations üöÄ. I'm comfortable with frontend tooling as well (webpack, npm, yarn, sass, less...) and I'm familiar with ReactJS. I'm in charge of all the CI/CD process using Gitlab as well as the Linux web servers (our infrastructure was audited by a devops company in Paris and our CI/CD process was evaluated as excellent). I'm very interested by the Go language and I have been leveraging it in some personal projects.

I am open to similar positions but I am also ready for new adventures, wether it is on a different stack, or more devops-oriented or also for a managerial position.

work.summary:
Managed the development of web applications as well as EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) and ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) interactions in a very challenging industrial environment for TLD Group, world leader of Ground Support Equipment. 
Actively supported progressive migration of all the legacy codebase (~800K LOC of old procedural PHP4/5 code) to the Symfony framework and PHP7 and PHP8, delivering new features and bug fixes daily. In charge of the web portals rewriting during the ERP migration. 
Managed the international team, involved in new developers interviews and technical tests, intensively contributed to the code review process, priorized tasks, collaborated and worked on specifications, managed communication with external providers.
highlights: Symfony encapsulation of a legacy system
Progressive migration of a big procedural codebase
ERP migration from Baan IV to Infor LN
Complex business analysis for a large and diverse manufacturing company

work.summary:
Developed the several versions of the services and purchasing platform for 750 french pharmacies and handled the R&D for several side projects as well. Successfully maintained and optimized several Apps and APIs to respond to a high and time-critical demand of POC (Proof Of Concepts) and Beta versions for the commercial and management teams. 
Successfully designed a complex REST API exposing data resulting from live and advanced processing of sales data coming from the pharmacists ERP. 
Accomplished a big and robust refactoring of all systems to a service-oriented architecture in 2015. 
Products built during those years allowed the company to raise 7M‚Ç¨.
highlights: Management and coaching of 9 frontend and backend developers

work.summary: Managed my own company during five years (including two with an associate). Promoted, enlarged, reinforced and monetized my skills in web development and graphic design on behalf of various companies (including Apodis Pharma which became my employer) and public administrations.
highlights: Commercial and technical relations with customers

work.summary: Teacher in graphic design and web technologies for the University and for the private school Notre-Dame-La-Riche (~500h per year).

Involved in many of the administrative and communication-related processes inside the theater, from fine analysis of audience until mass-mailing, including comedians welcoming, openers hiring and ticketing systems management

volunteer.position: Local presidency, National Bureau and National Secretariat
highlights: Management of a national association with ~15000 members

volunteer.summary: Helping those in need for Christmas
highlights: Spending a Christmas dinner with them

courses: One-day workshop with William Kennedy (Managing partner at Ardan Labs)

education.studyType: Golang, Learn how to code by Todd McLeod
courses: Learn how to code by Todd McLeod
Coaching and reviews of TLD Developments

references.name: Martin Degenne - TLD
references.reference:
After working in his team for almost 2 years, I can say without a doubt that Philippe Carle is an excellent Lead Developer. 
During those two years, I spent at least an hour every week with him to follow my projects and find ways to deal with complex problems like optimization. He found time to teach me more about php and routing when I was struggling to understand parts of our technological stack and to listen to me when I had a different opinion about the best way to develop a solution. 
I know he was doing the same thing for everyone on the team but still never missed a meeting nor an important deadline despite the complicated and often tough environment. 
The team grew stronger thanks to him and I will happily work with him in the future if the opportunity presents itself.
